social_posts.post_text: Hello it’s me. #lensaai
My ballot for the 2022 Sight & Sound poll for THE GREATEST FILMS OF ALL TIME

Thrilled to share that Elisabeth Subrin’s short “Maria Schneider, 1983”, which I star in alongside Manal Issa and Aïssa Maïga, has just been nominated for Best Documentary Short at the prestigious César Awards in France. Congratulations to the team🏆

Happy Mother’s Day to my one and only. I’m over the moon that we got to spend a few weeks together in April in the US and over the holidays in the Philippines and she got to meet Sean. I love you Mama.

What an honor to be on the jury for the Queer Palm at this year’s Cannes Film Festival with Madame Le President John Cameron Mitchell, Cédric Succivalli, Louise Chevilotte and Zeno Graton. Thank you, Franck Finance-Madureira, for inviting me. 

My red carpet look:
Styling by @dora_fung88
Dress by @lanvin
Shoes by @giuseppezanotti
Makeup: @diorbeauty

Last summer I had the most fun time directing two episodes of the upcoming second season of THE SUMMER I TURNED PRETTY with some of the most talented young actors we have. Hope you all enjoy watching it as much as I did directing it. Thank you @jennyhan and @sarahkucserka for bringing me on and to a wonderful crew especially DP Sandra Valde-Hansen and AD @s_sabre_. Premieres July 14. #TeamCONRAD

Honored to be on the distinguished jury at this year’s Locarno Film Festival after Cannes in May. Genuinely feels like coming full circle after my debut feature SEÑORITA had its world premiere in competition a decade ago and APPARITION screened in the Open Doors program in 2020. See you at the Piazza Grande🐆
📸: @emiliomadrid 

 #REPOST @filmfestlocarno📝🌟 Time to announce our 2023 Jury members! 17 renowned film experts from across the globe will meticulously watch the films showcased at #Locarno76, to select the winners of this year’s edition, including the prestigious Pardo d'oro... 👀

Here are the members of the First Feature Jury! #repostios #repostw10

My artist residency at @macdowell1907 in late 2019–five weeks of creative inspiration and enchantment—is an experience I won’t soon forget. It’s where I started writing my next feature Tropical Gothic, and nurtured friendships with other fellows with whom I’ve gone on to make art like @andrewisamerican.

It’s a tremendous honor to be on the Host Committee for MacDowell Medal Day this year honoring Canadian filmmaker and activist Alanis Obomsawin. Thank you, MacDowell and Josh Siegel, for inviting me. 

If you’re free this coming Sunday, July 23, come and join arts lovers during our free and open-to-the-public celebration at MacDowell in Peterborough, NH. See more details below!

REPOST @macdowell1907 with @get__repost__app  Medal Day poster reveal! We can’t wait for you to join us when we celebrate filmmaker 𝐀𝐥𝐚𝐧𝐢𝐬 𝐎𝐛𝐨𝐦𝐬𝐚𝐰𝐢𝐧 with the 63rd #MacDowellMedal on Medal Day at MacDowell on 𝐒𝐮𝐧𝐝𝐚𝐲, 𝐉𝐮𝐥𝐲 𝟐𝟑!

Around Peterborough and the Monadnock region, you may have begun to notice our beautiful Medal Day posters, featuring a portrait of Obomsawin by Julie Artacho/@coeurdartacho (courtesy of National Film Board of Canada/@ONF_NFB).

𝐌𝐞𝐝𝐚𝐥 𝐃𝐚𝐲 𝐒𝐜𝐡𝐞𝐝𝐮𝐥𝐞:
- Ceremony: 12:15pm
- Picnic Lunch: 1:15pm
- Open Studios for Artists-in-Residence: 2 – 4pm

The ceremony will begin with an introduction by @Jesse.Wente, author, broadcaster, and chairperson of the Canada Council for the Arts/@conseilartscan.

Medal Day is free and open to the public and takes place rain or shine!

If you are interested in volunteering to help MacDowell on Medal Day with parking, greeting, and more, please contact MacDowell Program Coordinator Dan Millbauer at dmillbauer@macdowell.org

The 2023 Medal Day at MacDowell is generously sponsored by the Putnam Foundation, Welch & Forbes, @RiverMeadCCRC, @FranklinPierceUniversity, Millyard Bank, BCM Environmental Law, Delta Dental, @MarcumLLP, and @SavingsBankOfWalpole.

#AlanisObomsawin #MacDowellResidency #repostios #repostw10

Celebrating independent & world cinema as a member of the First Features jury at the @filmfestlocarno. Can’t wait to discover the auteurs of the future from a genuinely international program that spans Singapore, India, Serbia, Mexico, Portugal, Qatar, Norway and many other countries. 

Outfit by @diotima.world
Shoes by @miumiu 
Styling by @dora_fung88

Another day at Locarno, another day of feasting on international cinema. Today I saw a Mexican and a Swiss/French film for the First Features competition, caught the new Lav Diaz. In an hour, I’m seeing the new Radu Jude. AND met up with @Letterboxd for this fun photo shoot. Thank you, @ellakemp! #locarnofilmfestival

An incredible honor to be the Artist-in-Residence at New York University’s Asian/Pacific/American Institute for the 2023–24 Academic Year. 

"What does it mean to be a diasporic Philippine-born filmmaker? How does that influence one’s subjectivity, ideological or political concerns, and aesthetic sensibility?... A tremendous honor, the residency arrives at a pivotal juncture in my evolution as a filmmaker. A singular aesthetic has emerged in my work–a political impulse merged with a style that is lyrical, sensual, poetic. My style evolved as a result of experimentation and artistic risk-taking, something that I want to take to more ambitious and radical heights.... After all, the most transgressive thing I can do as a diasporic artist is to defy the supposed boundaries of cinema to create something bold, original, and transcendent."

Message from A/P/A: 
Isabel Sandoval has called cinema “a gesture of empathetic imagination” and her films have been described as exhibiting a “muted, serene aesthetic.” Focusing on the theme “Learning as We Go,” this year we look to explore the forms and avenues education can take, as a response to the many attacks on critical race theory, affirmative action, diversity, inclusion, and equity efforts, and academic freedom that face scholars, teachers, and students in our current moment, as well as to attacks on LGBTQ+ rights and healthcare. We take much inspiration from Sandoval’s body of work, which asks us to see, and learn from, the histories and contemporary lives of immigrant laborers, LGBTQ+ folk, and colonized peoples in an entirely new, provocative, and compassionate manner. We are honored to have Isabel Sandoval join us as the 2023-24 Artist-in-Residence.

More to come soon.

Closing night ceremony of the 76th Locarno Film Festival with my fellow First Feature competition jurors Devika Girish and Omar El Zohairy. Our jury was ecstatic to confer the award to Nelson Yeo’s formally inventive and mesmerizing Dreaming and Dying. Congrats to Yeo and producer Si En Tan for such an exquisite film. 

Much thanks to the festival and artistic director Giona Nazzaro for inviting us this year and our jury liaison Francesca Fumagalli for a wonderful time at the festival. 

Look:
Styling: Dora Fung
Dress, shoes and accessories: MIU MIU

A wonderful evening of insightful conversation about Migrant Asian cinema with Devika Girish and Genevieve Yue to kick off my artist residency at New York University’s Asian/Pacific/American Institute #REPOST @apainstitute with @get__repost__app "Everything about you that you've been taught to think should silence, oppress, or marginalize you is what makes you exceptional. It's the source of your power. It's what will embolden us to question, criticize, and oppose the current standards of art in America and to take it to a radical, unexplored place."

It was an honor to officially welcome Isabel Sandoval (@isabelvsandoval) as A/P/A Institute's 2023-24 Artist-in-Residence. Before a curated screening and conversation, with Genevieve Yue (@genevieveyue, @thenewschool) and Devika Girish (@devikagirgayi, @thenyff), highlighting flashpoints and themes in Asian diasporic cinema, Sandoval reflected on her journey as an artist, writer, migrant, and filmmaker. 

A recording will be posted on YouTube soon, and on Monday, October 16 at 6:00 p.m., you can see Sandoval in conversation with creative director and collaborator Clint Ramos (@clintramos) at the NYU Cantor FIlm Center. RSVP link in bio. 🎥🎞

Photographs ©Myaskovsky: Courtesy of NYU Photo Bureau. #repostios #repostw10
A/P/A Institute at NYU's 2023-24 Artist-in-Residence, at the A/P/A Institute on September 27, 2023. Photographs ©Myaskovsky: Courtesy of NYU Photo Bureau.
#REPOST @sightsoundmagazine The greatest films of all time, as voted for by Isabel Sandoval for the #SightAndSoundPoll #repostios #repostw10

#REPOST @_jeanie_c 🎬 ‘Screen Test: Isabel’ 🎬 by Andrew Ondrejcak [@andrewisamerican] featuring Isabel Sandoval

November’s Midnight Moment is looking extra monumental and there’s 5 more nights to catch it  synchronized across 100 screens in @timessquarenyc from 11:57pm to 12am

Ondrejcak remixes cinematic history as a series of screen tests starring Sandoval, who shape-shifts through these iconic Hollywood films:

🪟Jane Wyman in ‘All That Heaven Allows’ (1955) directed by Douglas Sirk

🎩Marlene Dietrich in ‘Morocco’ (1930) directed by Josef von Sternberg

👂🏼Isabella Rossellini in ‘Blue Velvet’ (1986) written and directed by David Lynch

🪐Jane Fonda in ‘Barbarella’ (1968) directed by Roger Vadim

🥛Malcolm McDowell in ‘A Clockwork Orange’ (1971) directed by Stanley Kubrick

🌳Jessica Chastain in ‘The Tree of Life’ (2011) written and directed by Terrence Malick

📹: Videography by @tatyanatenenbaum 
📷: @michaelhull

‘Screen Test: Isabel’ is a special edit of ‘The Actress’ originally commissioned by @paulaswallace for @scaddotedu #repostios #repostw10
Screen Test: ISABEL

My three features—SEÑORITA, APPARITION and LINGUA FRANCA—will be coming to The Criterion Channel on January 1st. 

From The Criterion Collection: “Three by Isabel Sandoval
Featuring an interview with the director, part of Criterion’s Meet the Filmmakers series
“I’m drawn to women with secrets,” says acclaimed Filipina director Isabel Sandoval, who toys with genre conventions in her subversive portraits of women tangled up in complex sociopolitical realities. A true auteur, Sandoval wrote, produced, directed, and starred in her feature debut, Señorita, the gripping, noir-tinged story of a trans woman’s struggles to quit sex work and start a new life. Individual and social crises again collide in Apparition, an intense psychological drama set in a Filipino convent being gradually consumed by the encroaching political unrest of the Marcos era. And with Lingua Franca, Sandoval reached new levels of acclaim, starring alongside Twin Peaks: The Return’s Eamon Farren in a character study that gives poignant expression to the experiences of an undocumented trans Filipina caregiver living in Brooklyn.”

FEATURING: Señorita (2011), Apparition (2012), Lingua Franca (2019)

A belated post but what a dream to have been on the Main Competition jury at the 2023 JioMAMI Mumbai Film Festival with the legendary Mira Nair, Australian director David Michod (Animal Kingdom) and French fest director Edouard Waintrop. A veritable feast of exciting new works of South Asian cinema. Thank you to Artistic Director Deepti DCunha (for the gorgeous saree, too!) and Head of International Programme Anu Rangachar for having me, and to filmmakers Aksh Calvan and Kush Patel for taking great care of the jury.

Auteur: Lingua Franca (Netflix), Under The Banner of Heaven (Hulu)
Rep: CAA
Inquiries: bobbyrock@team713.net
